instructions: Tap the region to select it. Tap the region again, then tap Loop. The region loops until the end of the song section , or until the beginning of the next region in the same track. You can change how long it loops by dragging the right edge of the region.

Tap the region to select it. Tap the region again, then tap Split. Drag the Split marker (with the scissors icon) left or right to the point where you want to split the region. Drag the Split marker down. To cancel the split, tap anywhere outside the region before dragging the Split marker down. To make multiple splits, move the Split marker to different parts of a region and drag it down in each part.

Make sure the regions are in the same track, with no other regions between them. Touch and hold the first region, then tap the other region or regions while holding the first one. The regions change colour to show they are selected, and a frame appears around the last selected region. Tap one of the selected regions, then tap Join.
Tap the region to select it. Tap the region again, then tap Cut, Copy or Delete.

Move the playhead to the point where you want the region to start. Tap the header of the track where you want to paste the region to select the track. Tap the track where you want to paste the region, then tap Paste. You can also tap an empty area of Tracks view, then tap Paste. In this case, the region is pasted into the currently selected track.
Tap the region you want to rename to select it, then tap it again. Tap Rename. Type a new name for the region, then tap Done.
